column1: 6074,"WN388","Other Geo Things","Members from OSGEO (Open Source Geospatial Foundation) developed [OpenDroneMap.org](http://opendronemap.org/), an open source project for processing aerial drone imagery, over the past 5 years. There is no direct relation with OpenStreetMap.  You can find a more detailed explanation on how it works [here](https://www.expouav.com/news/latest/opendronemap-toolkit-processing-aerial-drone-imagery/)"

11757,"WN511","Did you know that …","... about [OpenDroneMap](https://www.opendronemap.org/), an open source [program](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OpenDroneMap) that you can use to assemble orthophotomaps? Drone owners do not shoot orthophotomaps very often as the software for their assembly is quite expensive. This app is designed to change this situation. By the way, orthophotoplans themselves can be stored on the [OpenAerialMap](https://Openaerialmap.org) server, from which you can access them for mapping in OSM."

11863,"WN513","Software","We have [written](http://weeklyosm.eu/archives/13118/#wn511_22405) earlier about the open source program [OpenDroneMap](https://opendronemap.org) that can be used to assemble orthophotomaps. This [article](https://gis-lab.info/qa/opendronemap-intro.html) ![(ru)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/ru.svg) (automatic [translation](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl"

column7: 16717,WN639","Mapping","Jake Coppinger [shared](https://jakecoppinger.com/2022/10/the-drying-green-opening-a-new-green-square-park/) his mapping efforts around 'The Drying Green', a newly opened park in Sydney, Australia. He created orthoimagery and a 3D model using OpenDroneMap, which is published on OpenAerialMap."

column1: 16809,"WN641","Did you know that …","... Klas Karlsson's was [surprised](https://twitter.com/klaskarlsson/status/1583401741386936320) by better than anticipated results using a GoPro on a stick and @OpenDroneMap?"

17023,"WN647","Mapping","Jake Coppinger [demonstrated](https://jakecoppinger.com/2022/12/creating-aerial-imagery-with-a-bike-helmet-camera-and-opendronemap/) how it is possible to use a 360 degree camera and OpenDroneMap to produce point clouds, which are an adequate alternative to aerial imagery."

17478,"WN660","Mapping","Jake Coppinger [shared](https://jakecoppinger.com/2023/03/generating-aerial-imagery-with-your-iphones-lidar-sensor/ ) details on how you can create your own aerial imagery and 3D models of streets with the built-in iPhone LiDAR sensor (iPhone Pro 12 or later, 2020+ iPad Pro) and open source tools in the [OpenDroneMap](https://www.opendronemap.org/) package. All you need to do to capture the model is walk around with your iPhone at ground level."

20929,"WN747","Programming","HOTOSM's tech updates for November 2024 highlighted ongoing projects, including the alpha launch of [Drone Tasking Manager](https://dronetm.org/) with OpenDroneMap integration, testing of FastAPI for the Tasking Manager, and development of [fAIr 2.0](https://fair.hotosm.org/) with YOLOv8 model for building detection, as well as improvements to [uMap authentication](https://umap.hotosm.org/en/)."
